WRITING.TEXT:
I have had 2 pass through entities. An S corporation and an LLC. You dont pay any taxes to the entity. The profit or loss flows to personal income tax and you pay it on your personal income tax. The tax forms for the entity are for your profit and loss. Basically revenues - expenses. I paid an accountant to do this. The final number went to my personal income tax.
You already get a ton of tax breaks as a business owner. I was pulling down about $250k and My total taxes was about 18% for everything. Federal, state, local, social security, medicaid. If my tax rate was 15% and im guessing this means you dont pay any social security or medicare tax if you are taxed through the entity, I would have paid maybe 5% in federal taxes and then another 3% maybe in state. Likely lower. I also didnt have all the gimmick deductions trump has.

This is apples and oranges. Guarantees contracts without a way to terminate means they could tae oreilly off the air, but be required to pay him. My understanding is they have a clause to allow them to negotiate a settlement if the sexual harrassment becomes public. It was on cnn.
In a sense a guaranteed contract does protect you from breaking the law. If no out, you still get paid. I dont know where you would get a contract that has felony protection. So you get paid while in jail, but if its not there they would still owe you money.
Press reports are stating they have an out clause in his contract about sexual harrassment. Supposedly he wont get his full contract. It was n cnn. I doubt they will release the terms.

There were less extraneous stuff to sped money on. No cell phones or internet. Cable as t everywhere, had less channels so it was cheaper if you could get it. Michael Jordan grew up without watching the NBA because there was no CBS affiliate in his small town.
I think housing was cheaper because
1. Houses were smaller. Houses have grown in size so this leads to higher prices
2. Suburbs were not as crowded so lower prices. We have not spread at a pace that has kept up with population growth.
College was cheaper because administrators hadnt yet realized they could jack up their salaries by building more buildings and making students pay for it. They are treating a not for profit as a for profit for themselves.
